column5: Kinda figured so as i am on that part of the lake from april till Oct ever year for the past 20 years ...this spring if your out call me on the VHF ...
I'll be out there with my new wire rods.
Did you say wire ......my fav rod to grab in the morning ...i find it doesn't work as well in the spring due to fishing so shallow but june july can you say Zing ...... can't beat wire Dipsy

Hey Fishmaster!  This 38 inch girl is my first and only salmon - caught off the rocks in Port Credit last fall.  I fish that river nearly every saturday and sunday of the open water season.  This spring I'm gettin' a small boat so come fall I won't have to fight for elbow room on shore!  I'm going to park myself just out of casting range of the crazies on shore......Last year two guys almost went at it over a tangled line! hahaha no thanks!  UF
This is why we shouldn't use Fish Bonkers...

LOL  Actually its a disease mostly found mostly in hatchery fish called whirling disease it damages skeletal tissue and cartlidge.  I found this out after i caught a fish in Bronte creek that looked similar to that one in the pic, did some research and found articles like this. http://www.courier-journal.com/apps/pbcs.d...608/1002/SPORTS

I've started fishing for the big boys in the big O and Errie waters last year. Planning to start early and be more regular this year.Need to get myself another downrigger and second rod/reel combo and I'll be set to go. Always looking for good company on the water as well. Here is a nice one from last August on Lake O.    Cheers, Ice Fisherman

anyone got any tips for me? I have a 14' lund deep with a 15hp honda four. I am going to start the lake O salmon this year. My set up is 2 big john electrics that I bought a few years back and some spoons ( have no clue were I got em) I live in ajax so I am gona be out at both nuke plants (pickering and darlington) but I really don't have a good idea on speeds or baits or even how far out from the cannon ball I should be back with my baits. I used to fish salmon as a kid with a family friend my biggest was a 28pnd chin, with a serious coho at one time as big as a carp but lost it ( insert fish story here) ever since then I have had the itch to go out again but never had the means till now. Any ideas on how to get a good start for speeds? or baits?

Get yourself some Spin Doctors Mountain Dew Crush and Atomik flies ....find what depth the fish are let out 10 ft lead hook to your ball you will catch fish ..Lymans are also good NK spoons Dream Weaver Spoons when ya go to a tackle store look on the wall for the last of that color lure  thats usally the hot baits
How many people from this site fish Salmon & Trout on Lake Ontario...thought maybe we could share some tips this spring
There's a good idea! Share some tips please!

I got out a few times last year, got a few fish with in-line planer boards early, then a couple fish in August off the Rigger and off Dipsey's...Got a second rigger for this year, and some more rods, planning to do more of it since i'm minutes away from Lake O.
Thanks for the words, Dax.....good stuff. Best of luck this coming season. I have a feeling that this will be an excellent year for everyone here.
Tiller!   Gerritt.

i love salmon fishing and fish lake ontario lots of times and have been chartering for about 15 yrs,and i have crewed on several boats and fish the derbys as well,i will start in a few weeks from now,down around port dalhousie,that pic of you looks like the welland canal.i love that spot in early april ....cant wait.....

Yes wont be long we will be off the south shore pounding the Kings ..i use to run the big boards 90% of the time in the spring for kings now its all little Walleye boards running Reef Runners and Silver Streaks with a small dipsy .. this year i have a wack of new products to try for spring had awesome fishing with them late last summer ..Kone Zones and Split Kings..they will be my 1st attemp this spring ..i usally start my charters the 1st 2nd weekend of april not sure if i will be able to get in that early this year ..if not ill be fishing outa the tinner till the marina unthaw..
Im thinking that picture is in between Port D and Jordan
That is what the Bare does - Salmon hunt - pm me - lots of tips

I just started last sumer out on Lake O mostly out of Whitby. Was my 1st year and I love it. Can't wait to get the boat back out on the water. Had a pretty good summer for someone who didn't (or still doesn't) know anything about downriggin!! As for tips I'm not too sure I can pass any your way but I'm always interested in new ideas.  Craig
Fell free to ask anything you wana no Caper ..you can never no enough about fishing salmon..
Checkout Floatfishing.net for river fishing too..ya gotta sign on though.
Is this what you're talkin' bout,,,,,only a few weeks away    Cheers, G.
Spring Salmon fishing in 2 Words...  Planer Boards!  Won't be long now folks! Tony
yahhh baby!!!!  see ya Sunday perhaps Gav

Thats what im talking about O Ya can't wait to get the boat uncovered and back in action ....i didn't get to pull to many in myself last year but landed a hell of alote for others ..this one was caught on a Froggie Hot Spot with a glow Batrix .  Here are some other pictures if ya wana have a lookie http://shardcastle.photosite.com/album1/
Here's a tip for you, don't eat anything you catch in Lake Ontario. I've only caught 5 chinook from Lake O and 2 were horribly deformed.
There is nothing wrong with eating Salmon from Lake Ont ....that fish was deformed from the Hacth..  See your HUmpy in the center ..its not very easy to pick out all the bad fish outa a Million Fry..

We did the salmon thing for years but we are getting out a lot later in the day and have to pass over some great walleye spots on the way so we spent most of last year fishing eyes.  Now that we decided to ell with the big $ derby tickets freinds are asking to go after the salmon and I hope to get out more this year.

Fish have abnormalities regardless of the body of water!! The big "O" has its fair share of beautiful fish, and in my opinion is a world class fishery that we have right in our back door.  For instance take a gander at these beauties from last year:  Big King @ Night:     My Bro & Pops With a descent king and a 17lb COHO what a beaut!    GOOD MORNING Miss "O"    Breathtaking Morning:    What A Bigun!! (Notice the smile talk about proud of myself!)     Were Lucky to have such a quality fishery in our back yard!!!  and theres nothing wrong with taking a little one home for the BBQ These are short lived animals, im sure if you ate a twenty pound pike (20 yrs old) from the same waters that would be plenty of time for it to build up a signifiquent amount of mercury in its flesh, but a 5 lbs salmon is probably around 1 yr old, I highly doubt thats enough time to build up to much mercury in its flesh. Just my opinion,  Jason!

I finally got a boat big enough to start playing in the big waters for the salmon last fall.  Hoping to be on Lake Ontario within the next few weeks learning how to catch them.  Should be fun, hopefully won't take too long to catch onto what they like.  Can't wait!
Arron and Barry did a great show on spring salmon,  if you can find it lots of good information on it.  Ahhh bring on the spring
YEAHHHHHHHHHH roll on the spring kings we need some more DINKS like this 33lber

Spring is right around the corner which means times for Lakers and Salmon. Can't wait. First start with planners, then dipsys then riggers, then casting Cleos in fall.  An early spring Salmon from Last year   An early Lake Trout from last spring   Cheers Al www.alsadventures.ca
Correct Fishmaster, that pic was just past Charles Daley heading west...You can see the Beacon(used to be the family business) in the top right corner!
